meanings.definition: An officer of the highest rank in the armed forces.
meanings.sent1: The marshall led the troops into battle.
meanings.sent2: The marshall saluted the general before giving orders.
meanings.sent3: The marshall joked that his uniform made him look like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The marshall's presence on the battlefield was like a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: The marshall's hat was adorned with a golden badge of honor.

meanings.definition: To arrange or assemble in order.
meanings.sent1: Please marshall the books on the shelf by size.
meanings.sent2: She had to marshall her thoughts before giving the presentation.
meanings.sent3: He tried to marshall his toys neatly, but they kept falling over.
meanings.sent4: The students were able to marshall their ideas into a cohesive argument.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to marshall all the ingredients before starting to cook.

meanings.definition: A title of nobility in England.
meanings.sent1: The marshall inherited the title from his ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The marshall's estate was vast and grand.
meanings.sent3: The marshall's pet dog acted like a noble knight in the castle.
meanings.sent4: The marshall's presence at the ball was regal and dignified.
meanings.sent5: The marshall's portrait hung in the great hall of the manor.
